summary: XMLHttpRequest.prototype.send doesn't accept XML Document as data

comments.content:
According to the documentation of the XMLHttpRequest object the send method allows sending a plain text or a XML document. But when trying to pass a Document type variable to the send method the closure compiler complains:

ERROR - actual parameter 1 of XMLHttpRequest.prototype.send does not match formal parameter
found   : (Document|null|string)
required: (null|string|undefined)
    requestor.send(data);

I worked around this problem by always casting the data to a string:

    requestor.send((/** @type {string} */ data));


But this is just a temporary solution. Please add Document to the allowed types of this parameter.
This issue was closed by revision r718.
